column1: The '''House of Elros''' was the line of descendants begun by [[Elros]], the son of [[Eärendil]] and brother of [[Elrond]]. Due to his ancestry, he was counted as one of the [[Half-elven]], and given the choice of the life of the [[Eldar]] or the [[Gift of Men]]. He chose to live as a mortal, but was granted an extraordinary lifespan of five hundred years. He passed his longevity on to the descendants of his House, though none enjoyed such a count of years as Elros himself.

column2: Tar-Minyatur]], Elros was the first [[King of Númenor]]. After his time, that island was ruled by Kings and Queens of his House through nearly three thousand years of the [[Second Age]]. In the end, Elros' distant descendant [[Ar-Pharazôn]] was manipulated by [[Sauron]] into bringing about the [[Downfall of Númenor]], and with it the end of the Line of Kings.<ref name="Kings">{{UT

column1: Though Númenor and its Kings were no more, the House of Elros did not end in the Downfall. The Kings had been descended through Elros' great-great-grandson [[Meneldur]], but another branch of the House also survived: the [[:Category:Lords of Andúnië
column2: Lords of Andúnië]], descended from Meneldur's elder sister [[Silmariën]]. The line of the Lords of Andúnië continued down to Elendil and his sons [[Isildur]] and [[Anárion]], and so was carried from Númenor to [[Middle-earth]], surviving in the [[Kings of Arnor]] and of [[Gondor]]. Even at the time of the [[War of the Ring]], some six thousand years after the death of its founder, there was still a living heir to the House of Elros: none other than [[Aragorn]] himself.

column1: A family of [[Faithful]] from [[Númenor]] had ruled over the land of [[Belfalas]] since the [[Second Age]]. This family of [[Númenóreans]] were akin to the Lords of Andúnië, and thus related to [[Elendil]] and descended from the House of Elros.<ref>{{UT
column2: Cirion}}</ref>  After the [[Downfall of Númenor]] they had been given the title ''Prince of Belfalas'' by [[Elendil]]<ref>{{UT
column3: Cirion}}, Note 39</ref> and their land, now a fief of [[Gondor]], was called [[Dor-en-Ernil]]. He granted this family a noble title, making them the hereditary Princes of Belfalas which was succeeded by the [[Prince of Dol Amroth

column1: ==The Family Tree of the House of Elros==
Showing the descendants of Elros Tar-Minyatur.  All information in the tree is from the ''Unfinished Tales'', either from the chart "The earlier generations of the Line of Elros"<ref>{{UT
column2: earlier}}</ref> or from "The Line of Elros: Kings of Númenor"<ref name="Kings"/> unless otherwise specified.<ref group="note">"The Earlier Generations of the Line of Elros" is only included in some editions of ''Unfinished Tales''.</ref> The figures after the names are those of birth and death where recorded (when only one figure is shown it is the date of birth).  A dagger symbol, '†' signifies those who did not die of old age.  A name preceded by '*' indicates one of the ruling Kings or Queens of Númenor; an ''italicized'' name denotes a female.  A vertical dashed line indicates a line of descent with some members missing.  Some rulers have a name before the '*', which was their "right name" before taking the [[Sceptre of Númenor

column1: ===The Earlier Generations of the Line of Elros===
<div style="overflow-x: scroll; overflow-y: hidden; border: 1px solid #AAAAAA; padding: 3px; background: #EEEEEE;">

column40:
ELR=[[Elros]]
* Tar-Minyatur
''FA 531-SA 442''
Elros Tar-Minyatur lived for 500 years, longer than any other of his line.}}

column35:
Vardamir Nólimon]]
''61-471''
Vardamir did not ascend the throne when Elros died but gave the sceptre to his son, thus establishing the tradition of yielding the Sceptre before death and dying of free will while yet in vigour of mind.

column25:
SIL=''[[Silmarien]]''
''521''
Silmarien was the eldest child of Tar-Elendil but since the Sceptre by the law at that time went to the eldest male child, her brother Írimon became king.

column26:
ANA=Anardil
* [[Tar-Aldarion]]
''700-1098''
Tar-Aldarion had only one child, a daughter. He altered the [[Law of Succession in Númenor]] so that the eldest daughter of a king could succeed.
column28:
Wife}}
Erendis is said to have perished in water at the haven of [[Rómenna]].

column1: ===The Later Generations of the Line of Elros===
<div style="overflow-x: scroll; overflow-y: hidden; border: 1px solid #AAAAAA; padding: 3px; background: #EEEEEE;">

column14:
TEL=* ''[[Tar-Telperiën]]''
''1320-1731''
Died childless
Tar-Telperiën became the second ruling queen even though she had a brother; apparently the law of succession was of simple primogeniture. She was the first ruler to not surrender the Sceptre before death.

column16:
ATN=* [[Tar-Atanamir]]
the Great
''1800-2221''
Tar-Atanamir the Great was also called "the Unwilling" since he was the first king to refuse to lay down his life or to renounce the Sceptre.}}

column14:
HER=[[Herucalmo]]
* [[Tar-Anducal]]
''2286-2657''
Herucalmo, the husband of Tar-Vanimeldë, took the sceptre upon her death, calling himself Tar-Anducal. He was not counted in the Line of Kings as the 17th ruler.

column16:
CAL=* [[Tar-Calmacil]]
(Ar-Belzagar)
''2516-2825''
Tar-Calmacil was the first to be called (by the King's Men) by his name in Adûnaic: Ar-Belzagar.}}

ADU=* [[Ar-Adûnakhôr]]
(Tar-Herunúmen)
''2709-2962''
Ar-Adûnakhôr was the first to take the sceptre with an Adûnaic title (however, his name was inscribed in the Scrolls in Quenya as Tar-Herunúmen).}}

column8:
AMA=[[Amandil]]
Last Lord
of Andúnië
Amandil sailed into the West to seek clemency for Númenor; he was never heard from again.
column9:
MIR=''[[Tar-Míriel]]''
''(Ar-Zimraphel) ''
''3117-3319'' †
Míriel should have been the fourth Ruling Queen, but upon the death of her father her cousin Pharazôn took her to wife against her will and usurped the sceptre. She died in the Downfall.
column10:
PHA=* [[Ar-Pharazôn]]
(Tar-Calion)
''3118-3319'' †
Ar-Pharazôn seized the sceptre from Míriel. He died in the Downfall.}}
